title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
description:
Intro
Vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten|International tätiges Unternehmen
Firmenprofil

Unser Kunde ist ein führendes Unternehmen in der Pharma-Branche, das sich auf die Entwicklung und Vermarktung von hochwertigen medizinischen Produkten konzentriert. Mit einem leidenschaftlichen Team von Fachleuten, die sich der Verbesserung des Gesundheitswesens verschrieben haben, streben wir danach, das Leben von Patienten zu bereichern und die medizinische Versorgung weltweit zu verbessern.
Aufgabengebiet
• * Datensammlung und -verarbeitung aus verschiedenen internen und externen Finanzquellen.
• Entwicklung und Pflege von Finanz-Dashboards und Berichten für das Management und Finanzteams zur Unterstützung bei der Budgetierung, Forecasting und Geschäftsplanung.
• Analyse von Finanzdaten, um Trends, Muster und Einsparungspotenziale zu identifizieren und die finanzielle Performance des Unternehmens zu optimieren.
• Erstellung von Finanzmodellen und Prognoseberichten, um fundierte... Entscheidungen zu Investitionen und Finanzstrategien zu treffen.
• Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Finanzteam, um Finanzdaten zu validieren, Compliance-Richtlinien einzuhalten und finanzielle Prozesse zu verbessern.

Anforderungsprofil
• Abgeschlossenes Studium in Finanzen, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Fachbereich.
• Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse mit Schwerpunkt auf Finanzdaten und -berichterstattung.
• Ausgeprägte Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Finanzkennzahlen und Erfahrung mit Finanzplanungs- und Analysetools.
• Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, um komplexe Finanzdaten zu interpretieren und datengestützte Geschäftsempfehlungen abzuleiten.
• Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit mit Finanzteams und anderen Abteilungen, um datengesteuerte Finanzstrategien zu entwickeln.
Vergütungspaket

Für diese Position wird ein Bruttojahresgehalt von mindestens € 70.000,- geboten. Je nach Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung besteht die Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung.

title: Business Analyst - Global Market Intelligence (m/f/d)
description:
OVERVIEW:

As part of one of the fastest-growing digital sports companies worldwide, you are responsible for the business analysis of the European region. In this high impact role, you will work closely with Sportradar’s regional sales team to understand the market and needs of all relevant stakeholders. You will also cooperate with all product and service units of Sportradar, take the vision of senior management, add your expertise and know-how and translate that into concrete projects.

The Global Commercial Intelligence team collects information of our business environment such as customer, competitors and markets in the respective territories. Based on this information the team provides analysis to support dedicated strategic as well as commercial decisions, sales activities and new business development.

THE CHALLENGE:
• Be innovative in your way of thinking and technically savvy
• Be effective at cross-team collaboration, building consensus, and communicating a vision
• Be... comfortable working with complex data challenges at scale, diverse products, and a global footprint in a fast-paced environment
• Gather information about competitors, customers, and partners concerning financials figures, pricing, product features, technologies and projects
• Identify general industry trends & market developments
• Monitor the regulatory and legal frameworks
• Analyze and provide regional input to the global content and multi-platform strategy
• Develop a regional Pricing and Packaging strategy
• Identify capability gaps and product improvements as well as new markets and innovations
• Provide regional input for our Product Roadmap and a go-to-market strategy
• Identify potential M&A targets and support due diligence

YOUR PROFILE:
• Demonstrable experience in business analysis and/or product management, preferably within betting & gaming, internet businesses, banking & finance and/or other high transactional environments
• Excellent understanding of geographical markets and using data to identify trends
• A very structured way of working with an attention to detail and an urge of ownership
• Strong track record of analyzing product and market environments
• Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken), any other European language will be considered a plus
• Resourceful, problem-solving attitude
• Analytical minded, accurate & proactive
• Relevant academic qualifications

OUR OFFER:
• Become part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in the digital sports environment and help us scale our operations
• Be part of a highly motivated, innovative, and dynamic team with people from more than 40 nationalities in our office
• Exciting job field with the opportunity for personal development
• Education and training, like German and English courses and Sportradar eAcademy
• Flexible working hours
• Workshops and life insurance policy
• Tickets for sports events and concerts, as well as darts, table football, and table tennis for after-work sports activities in the office
• Team activities, like Happy Hours or charity, summer and year-end party

The minimum monthly salary for this position is according to the Collective Bargaining Agreement, overpayment will be considered depending on qualifications and working experience

description:
Delivery Hero Austria und die Marke foodora sind Teil des Delivery Hero Netzwerkes , einer der größten globalen Essensbestellplattformen. Unser international agierendes Team ist bereits in mehr als 50 Ländern tätig. foodora bietet seinen mehr als 250 Mitarbeiter:innen die Dynamik und das Entwicklungspotenzial eines Startups, gleichzeitig wird Rückhalt und Förderung durch die Unternehmensgruppe und das lokale Management gesichert.

Unser Team ist aufrichtig und ehrgeizig - gleichzeitig ist Spaß ein wichtiger Aspekt unseres Arbeitsalltags. Wir suchen motivierte und enthusiastische Teammitglieder, die uns auf unserer Mission begleiten. Auf den*die ideale:n Kandidaten:in, der*die vor allem durch eine innovative Denkweise und eine stark ausgeprägte "get-things-done” Mentalität überzeugt, wartet ein aufregender Job in Wien.

Wir suchen dich als

Business Intelligence Analyst (w/m/d)

Das erwartet dich:
• Führe komplexe Analysen basierend auf großen Datensätzen durch und wandle diese in... aufschlussreiche & umsetzbare Empfehlungen um
• Erstelle Berichte & Dashboards für verschiedene Stakeholder & Unternehmensbereiche insbesondere mit Fokus auf unser Logistics Department
• Tausche dich mit unserer EU Data Community aus, teile und lerne von Best-Practises und arbeite bei spannenden Projekten & Analysen mit
• Du informierst pro-aktiv über Fakten und Erkenntnisse und trägst zu datenbasierten Geschäftsentscheidungen bei

Das bringst du mit:
• Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Mathematik, Wirtschaft, Naturwissenschaften oder vergleichbaren Feldern mit analytischem Schwerpunkt
• Du bringst mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung als BI/Data Analyst in einem Internet-, Retail-, oder fast-paced Tech-Unternehmen mit
• Exzellente analytische Fähigkeiten und Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit BI Tools wie Tableau, BigQuery, SQL, Looker, Google Suite, Excel
• Dir fällt es leicht große Datenmengen richtig zu interpretieren und qualitative Erkenntnisse und Einblicke zu generieren und zu präsentieren
• Du bist hoch motiviert, kommunikativ und pragmatisch im Umgang mit business challenges und sprichst zudem fließend Deutsch und ausgezeichnete Englischkenntnisse mit

• Unsere Unternehmensstruktur ist von flachen Hierarchien geprägt und Unterstützung durch deine Kolleg:innen ist dir sicher
• Berufliche Vielfalt, gelebte Kollegialität sowie ein motiviertes Team von dem du lernen und dich inspirieren lassen kannst

title: Business Intelligence Data Manager/Analyst & Developer (m/w/d)
description:
Ihre Hauptaufgaben
• Tatkräftige Optimierung und Weiterentwicklung interner BI-Tools (Qlikview, Excel, Access)
• Modellierung, Optimierung und Tuning von Datenbanken
• Zusammenführung von Daten verschiedener Informationsquellen und Aufbereitung zur Etablierung von Reporting als Self-Service
• Strategische Mitgestaltung beim Aufbau einer globalen, internationalen Reporting Factory
• Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung von Business Intelligence- und Datawarehouse-Lösungen
• Programmierung BI-Tools (VBA, SQL, Excel, Access)
• Optimierung von internen IT-Development Projekten im Finanzbereich

Ihr Profil
• Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung (HTL, FH, UNI) mit Schwerpunkt IT/Wirtschaftsinformatik
• Vorerfahrung mit Databanken und BI-Tools, SQL-Development und QV-Reporting
• Sicherer Umgang mit Datenstrukturen und relationalen Datenbanken
• Sehr gute MS-Office Kenntnisse (Excel und Access) und eine außerordentlich hohe IT-Affinität
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
• Ausgeprägte... Zahlenaffinität, analytisches Denken und Lösungsorientierung
• Hohe Team- und Innovationsfähigkeiten

Wir bieten Ihnen
• Spannende Projekte mit vielen Entwicklungs-möglichkeiten
• Ein team- und zukunftsorientiertes Umfeld in einem innovativen, internationalen Unternehmen
• Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Remote Work für eine ausgewogene Work-Life Balance
• Zentrales Büro in Wien, Europa-Hauptquartier

Zusatzinformation

Diese Position ist mit einem Bruttojahresgehalt von mind. EUR 52.500,- dotiert, wobei je nach Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung eine Überbezahlung vorgesehen ist. Darüber hinaus bieten wir eine Vielfalt an Benefits für Mitarbeiter*innen.

Ihr Ansprechpartner

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung vorzugsweise per E-Mail an: recruitment@hain-celestial.eu
Mona Naturprodukte GmbH

Mag. Alexandra Nothaft

Schottengasse 10, 1010 Wien

Über uns

Die MONA Gruppe, ein Tochterunternehmen der Hain Celestial Gruppe, ist ein führender Unternehmensverbund für Bio- und Naturprodukte mit Europazentrale in Wien.

Über 350 Mitarbeiter*innen haben sich den Werten hervorragender Geschmack, soziale und ökologische Verantwortung, Gesundheit und Natürlichkeit verschrieben.

MONA bietet eine breite Auswahl an veganen Milchalternativen aus Hafer, Reis, Soja sowie eine Vielzahl von Nuss-Varianten an, die unter den Marken JOYA und HAPPY vertrieben werden. Mit diesen Köstlichkeiten ist MONA in vielen europäischen Ländern Marktführer bei Frische- und UHT-Produkten auf Sojabasis. description:
**Introduction**

Are you looking for a career that will allow you to use your unique blend of business acumen and tech savvy? Business Analysts at IBM are subject matter experts that build the bridge between our business and our clients, immersing themselves into the market to understand problems and find innovative solutions. Be ready to navigate the complex relationships that make the business world run and find the actionable insights that result in great business decisions.
• *Your Role and Responsibilities**

WIR schaffen Innovationen für unsere Kunden und gestalten die Zukunft aktiv mit!

+ Projekte können für dich nicht spannend genug sein?

+ Eine gute Kundenbeziehung hat für dich oberste Priorität?

+ Du suchst nach einer neuen **Herausforderung** ?

Dann werde Teil unseres Teams und unterstütze uns bei einem vielseitigen Softwareintegrationsprojekt in der Versicherungsbranche.
• *Dein zukünftiger Arbeitsalltag:**

+ Du analysierst, konzipierst und erstellst Reports mittels... SAP Business Objects

+ Mittels enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Kunden erarbeitest du dessen Anforderungen

+ Du bist verantwortlich für SQL Abfragen und ETL Programmierung

+ Enthält die Koordination von Projekten im SAP BO Umfeld

+ Als Bindeglied kommunizierst du auf deutsch mit den Fachbereichen und der IT

+ Bedeutet Miteinander statt Gegeneinander - ständige Weiterentwicklung und Knowledge-Sharing sind Teil unserer Kultur

Deine Weiterbildung hat für uns Priorität. Tolle Trainings halten dich fachlich fit, auch solche mit Zertifikationsabschluß. In unserer flachen Hierarchie stehen dir viele Wege für deinen persönlichen Karriereweg offen. Wir bieten dir spannende Projekte, flexible Arbeitszeiten, ein modernes Umfeld und eine überkollektivvertragliche Entlohnung von € 40.600 brutto/Jahr, mit Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung abhängig von deiner Qualifikation und Erfahrung.
• *Required Technical and Professional Expertise**
• *Das finden wir in deinem Lebenslauf:**

+ Studium im Bereich (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Projektmanagement oder vergleichbare Ausbildung

+ Die Erstellung von Abfragen und Datenmodellen zur Gewinnung von Informationen für Reports und Frontends im BI-Umfeld ist dir bereits bekannt

+ Erfahrungen im Cognos oder Business Objects Umfeld sind von Vorteil

+ Eigeninitiative, analytische Arbeitsweise, Bereitschaft zur Weiterbildung, Teamfähigkeit und Kommunikationsvermögen

+ Ausgezeichnete Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
• *Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise**

+ Erfahrungen im Cognos oder Business Objects Umfeld sind von Vorteil
• *About Business Unit**

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter business by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.
• *Your Life @ IBM**

What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world. What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion. Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.
• *About IBM**

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.
• *Location Statement**

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.
• *Being You @ IBM**

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

in Full-time, starting immediately in Coburg, temporary for 2 years.
Experienced professionals and newcomers will find many attractive challenges with us, in addition to a great team of more than 10,000 nice colleagues and over 770 different job profiles that a modern insurance company faces:
Will the car of the future cause fewer accidents? What will old-age provision look like when everyone lives to be 100? We deal with the questions of tomorrow - to provide needs-based coverage for our more than 12 million customers - at our headquarters in Coburg, Upper Franconia, and at our 38 field offices in both the office and the field.
What you can look forward to Responsibility for the conception, creation and further... development of dashboards for the presentation of relevant KPIs.
Continuous optimization of the reporting structure to improve internal processes and control-relevant KPIs.
Design u.
Implementation of requirements from the services as well as analysis and optimization of the corresponding ETL processes.
Elaboration, further development and optimization of a transparent, highly automated performance monitoring.
Cost analysis to control budget compliance and measure actual performance against business plan Measurement of efficiency and effectiveness and preparation of results for different hierarchical levels.
Content support for overarching control processes with internal interfaces and contact:
inside What you bring with you Completed studies in (business) computer science, economics or a comparable field.
First professional experience as a "Data Engineer" or in a comparable position in an agile environment desirable Good experience with data visualization tools such as MS Power BI, Tableau, QlikView or similar.
Practical knowledge of using ETL tools, such as SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Strong enthusiasm for numbers and IT as well as strong affinity for data analysis, modeling, visualization.
Strong communication skills, strong ability to self-organize and enjoy working on your own initiative Quick response, decision-making and responsibility with a strong results-oriented approach to work.
What we offer Flexible working:
Flexible working for us means you adjust your working hours to your circumstances.
There is no core or minimum working time with us.
Instead, you perform your workload within a defined working time framework - adapted to local requirements if necessary.
Thanks to mobile work under certain conditions even up to half of the monthly working time from home or on the road.
Family-friendly working:
We attach importance to an optimal compatibility of family and career.
For us, this includes support for childcare and vacation care, as well as care for relatives, as well as the opportunity to take a management position part-time.
Since 2007, the audit berufundfamilie distinguishes us as a family-friendly employer.
Results-oriented remuneration:
in addition to your twelve monthly salaries, you will receive two collectively agreed special payments each year.
And so that performance is also worthwhile, you participate in a performance and results-based remuneration, with the chance to receive more than one additional monthly salary.
Your many years of loyalty to the company will also pay off:
you will receive an anniversary payment, graded according to your length of service.
Lifelong learning:
If you are working on the future, you must not remain in yesterday.
So that you are always up to date, we promote your professional development measures - internally and externally.
However, not only the acquisition of company- or job-specific qualifications is the focus of our training measures, but also the private promotion of individually desired skills - for example, language courses, driving safety training and much more.
Healthy work:
Keep fit and healthy.
We support you with free sports offers in our company-owned sports facilities or a subsidy for your membership in a gym.
Particularly active employees can participate in various HUK sports groups in their free time:
e.g.
running, biking or team sports such as soccer or basketball.
Or learn how to integrate a healthy lifestyle into your everyday life, both professionally and privately, in lectures and seminars.
And because health also concerns nutrition, enjoy healthy and handmade delicacies in our coffee bars or the company restaurant.
Have we piqued your interest? Then apply now! If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact Ms.
Uta Orlamünde under the telephone number +49 9561 96-13483, karriere@huk-coburg.de at your disposal

﻿ BI Developer/Analyst (m/f/x), HR Systems Job Number: 58405, City: Österreich, Graz Group Description At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise... gives us a competitive advantage. Role Summary The Business Intelligence (BI) Developer/Analyst will be responsible for interpreting the business needs of HR stakeholders and for developing the reporting analytics that meet those needs. This includes the design, development, maintenance, integration and reporting of business systems through cubes, ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. The Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst will work closely and effectively with internal stakeholders and business analysts to provide support and expertise in data management, reporting and underlying infrastructure. This position may also need to cover oversight and guidance on deliverables provided by external partners as well a supervising & leading role in the team. Key Responsibilities Work with the business to define reporting/BI requirements and translate those requirements into reporting/BI deliverables. Design complex business intelligence and analytic solutions based on functional requirements. Translate data results into written reports, tables, graphs, and charts. Ensure the availability and performance of the solutions and reports. Participate in and lead functional and technical specification reviews. Research technical solutions to solve business problems. Develop/train on company standards and procedures to support self-service BI. Provide training and technical assistance to other team members and users for generation of various types of reporting. Provide ongoing support for legacy and future BI solutions. Work Experience 3 to 5 Years of Work Related Experience. Knowledge and Education Completion of University Degree in the field of computer science or Information Technology. Key Qualifications/Requirements Experience in developing reporting or dashboard solutions with BI tools (PowerBI preferred). Experience in creating data models (SSAS Tabular Model preferred). Proficiency in ETL and Data Warehouse concepts. Strong SQL and scripting skills. Advanced skills in Microsoft BI stack (SSAS, Power Pivot, Power View, PowerBI). Self-motivated and self-managed with a high degree of analytical skills (quick comprehension, abstract thinking, recognize relationships). Ability to be a strong team member and communicate effectively. Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks. Demonstrated critical thinking and analytic skills with strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Ability to manage confidential and sensitive employee information. Ability to accurately collect information to understand and assess the clients’ needs and situation. Understanding of HR operations and processes, and experience in employee data management a nice to have. Excellent English language skills (written and oral). Additional Information Salary starting from 45 000 EUR/ gross/year. We offer attractive benefits (expl. profit participation, yearly bonus, development opportunities). For dedicated and motivated employees, we offer an interesting and diversified job within a dynamic global team together with the individual and functional development in a professional environment of a global acting business. title: Business Data Analyst:in 30-38,5h
description:
Unternehmen

Die Leidenschaft, anderen Freude zu bereiten, multipliziert mit mehreren Tausend kreativen und engagierten Köpfen.

Das ist das Erfolgsprinzip unseres Kunden CEWE, Europas führender Fotoservice und Markenhersteller im Fotofinishing. Kundenzentriertes Handeln und antizipieren von Trends sind Eckpfeiler der positiven Geschäftsentwicklung in den letzten Jahren. Um den Wettbewerbsvorteil zu erhalten, neue Marktchancen schnell zu erkennen und die vorhandene Informationsflut effektiv zu nutzen, wird am Standort Wien eine analytische und kommunikationsstarke Persönlichkeit mit einem stark ausgeprägten Zahlenverständnis gesucht.

Aufgaben

Dein spannendes Aufgabengebiet:
• Durch fundierte Datenanalysen gewinnst du relevante Erkenntnisse für unsere unternehmerische und unsere Marketingtätigkeit.
• Durch die Verknüpfung verschiedener Datenquellen werden deine Analysen noch fundierter.
• Du entwickelst das bestehende Berichtswesen mit neuen KPI und neuen regelmäßigen Analysen... weiter.
• Mit ad hoc Analysen beleuchtest du definierte Themenfelder.
• Identifizierung von Herausforderungen in der Datenqualität und Unterstützung bei deren Behebung.
• Du berätst das Marketingteam und die Geschäftsführung zu Fragen im Bereich Reporting und Analysen.
• Bei Interesse kannst du in team- bzw. unternehmensinternen Projekten mitarbeiten.

Anforderungsprofil

Du ergänzt uns perfekt, wenn du…
• Berufserfahrung im Bereich Business Intelligence, Data und Web Analytics hast.
• Erfahrung mit Webanalyse-Tools, vorzugsweise Adobe Analytics und mit der Erstellung von Dashboards hast.
• ein sicheres, professionelles Auftreten hast und gerne im Team arbeitest.
• die Klarheit von Zahlen zu schätzen weisst und ihre Geschichten erzählen kannst.
• Affinität zu Fotografie, Dekoration und Gestaltungstrends mitbringst, ist das ein Plus.

Sonstiges

Du fühlst dich bei uns wohl, weil..
• eine spannende und abwechslungsreiche Aufgabe auf dich wartet.
• wir ein familienfreundliches Unternehmen sind, in dem deine Work-Life-Balance wichtig ist.
• du einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz in einem wertschätzenden Umfeld und eine langfristige Perspektive mit Entwicklungs- und Entfaltungsmöglichkeiten vorfindest.

title: Intern – Business Intelligence (6 months) (m/f/d)
description:
ABOUT US

Our vision: We will become the most agile and nimble infrastructure bank in Europe. We help creating a better world by enabling sustainable infrastructure that improves the quality of people’s lives.

Always first: We are always first when it comes to delivering outstanding results with speed and precision. We never stand still. We take “always first” as an obligation to get better every day.

LOOKING FOR A NEW CHALLENGE?

In this entrepreneurial growth environment, Kommunalkredit is looking to expand its Corporate Development team in Vienna. It offers ample space for creativity, self-initiative and personal development.

Join our team Corporate Development, as
Intern – Business Intelligence (6 months) (m/f/d)

What do we offer

You will benefit from
• on-the-job training provided by internal experts
• company and team events, management briefings
• valuable insights into data-driven banking
• an international working environment

You will put your knowledge into practice as... part of the bank’s core team of corporate development by
• supporting the analysis and interpretation of data across the bank including set-up of dashboards and preparation of management reports
• cross-functional cooperation with front office, finance, IT and risk management divisions
• developing ideas and being part of project teams

You’re being supported in your studies through
• flexible working hours
• a potential collaboration in the context of your thesis
• You will experience growth

A competitive compensation of EUR 1.920 gross

What we expect
• You are in a bachelor’s or master’s degree program with business/economical/technical background
• First financial or project experience through internships
• Your friends and colleagues would describe you as a focused, pro-active person
• Superior analytical aptitude and creative problem-solving abilities
• Strong IT affinity and Excel skills – first experience in Tableau / VBA / SQL beneficial
• You are looking for a job in a dynamic organisation, where you can grow and learn

APPLY with motivation letter + CV

description:
METRO ist ein internationaler Lebensmittelgroßhändler mit einem vielfältigen Food- und Non-Food Sortiment, der bereits seit 50 Jahren in Österreich vertreten ist. Wir arbeiten weltweit für den Erfolg von unabhängigen Unternehmen. Wir arbeiten für über 500.000 Selbstständige österreichweit. Wir arbeiten für Umsetzer, Visionäre, Mutige, Abenteurer, jene die an sich glauben und ihre Träume verwirklichen. Wir arbeiten für unsere Kunden!

Zur Verstärkung unseres Business Intelligence Teams im Head Office in Vösendorf suchen wir einen

Business Analyst (m/w/d)
Vollzeit 38,5 Wochenstunden, ab sofort

Aufgaben

Ihre Aufgaben:
• Sie ergänzen unser BI Team und arbeiten aktiv an allen Analysen mit
• Sie sind verantwortlich für die Aufbereitung und den Versand regulärer Reportings
• Sie unterstützen operativ bei diversen Projekten
• Sie sind für ad hoc Analysen verantwortlich und unterstützen bei der Aufbereitung von Powerpoint-Präsentationen für den Einkauf sowie die Geschäftsführung
• Sie... analysieren Anwenderanforderungen zur Erstellung von Reports für unser Team
• Sie entwickeln und implementieren innovative Dashboards in unserem Reporting Tool

Profil

Ihre Qualifikationen:
• Sie haben eine abgeschlossene kaufmännische oder technische Ausbildung (z.B. Universität, FH, HTL, HAK)
• Sie haben Berufserfahrung in Analyse- oder Controlling Abteilungen
• Zahlenaffinität sowie analytisches Denkvermögen
• Sie verfügen über starke Excel-Kenntnisse und idealerweise haben Sie bereits mit Analysesoftware (wie z.B. MicroStrategy) gearbeitet
• Sie bringen gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse mit, um innerhalb des Konzerns zu kommunizieren
• Sie sind ein Teamplayer, arbeiten in Ihrem Aufgabengebiet aber selbstständig
• Sie arbeiten sich rasch in neue Themenstellungen und komplexe Aufgaben ein und bewahren auch in stressigen Situationen den Überblick

Wir bieten

Was wir bieten:
• Die Vorteile eines Großunternehmens mit ansprechenden Sozialleistungen wie Mitarbeiterrabatte, gratis Parkplatz und Vergünstigungen in unserem Betriebsrestaurant
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten im Rahmen unseres Gleitzeitmodells sowie Home Office Möglichkeit
• Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten bei METRO

Ihr Gehaltspaket:

Es ist uns wichtig, dass sich Ihr Gehalt an Ihren Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen orientiert. Gerne klären wir das gemeinsam im persönlichen Gespräch. Der guten Ordnung halber geben wir an, dass für diese Position ein Mindestgehalt von EUR 40.000,- brutto pro Jahr auf Vollzeitbasis gilt.

Haben wir Ihr Interesse an dieser Stelle geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung.
Ihr Kontakt bei Fragen: Frau Lucia Reiter

title: Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst
description:
Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. believeinyourself

Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst (all genders)

Location: Vienna

Working-Hours: Full-time

Occupation Area: IT

Company: Erste Group Bank AG

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.

We are an innovative and forward-thinking financial group, which places a high priority on cybersecurity. Our commitment to protecting our clients' data and financial information is a high priority. We are currently looking for a highly motivated and proactive Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst to join our team. If you are passionate about staying ahead of cyber threats, taking initiative and driving proactive... security measures, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.As a Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in identifying, analysing and initiating the mitigation of potential cyber threats to our bank's information systems. Your responsibilities will go beyond passive threat tracking; you will actively research and analyse threats based on information from various established Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) sources, propose solutions when needed, and trigger necessary actions across all our entities to protect our organisation from emerging threats. We value accountability and initiative and are looking for a candidate who can act autonomously to strengthen our cybersecurity posture.No leadership or management roles are expected. Duties will be a good balance of operational and coordinating tasks.

Your Tasks
• Monitor and assess external sources, intelligence feeds, and open-source information for potential threats
• Stay informed about the latest vulnerabilities and ensure that necessary stakeholders are alerted about the appropriate measures
• Collaborate with internal teams to develop and maintain an up-to-date threat intelligence database / reports
• Prepare comprehensive threat intelligence reports, including analysis, key information, and proposed actions.
• Communicate threat intelligence findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Take proactive accountability for proposing and implementing security measures without waiting for management directives.
• Support CTI service/product improvement in cooperation with the service providers and adjustment of the CTI strategy based on new use cases / requirements from business.
• Support local & Erste Group wide integrations of CTI platforms / data sources into internal security and reporting tools.
• Supervise the overall alert / incident handling (incl. identification of problems & improvement of related process) and active alert handling within CEE entities.
• Organize and (at a later stage) perform CTI service platform trainings.
Your Background
• University degree (e.g. computer science, communication engineering, digital forensics, Information/IT Security; etc.) and frist professional experience
• Good knowledge of cyber threat intelligence analysis methodologies and tools, including actual cyber-attack and prevention methods
• Excellent analytical skills and the ability to think critically to identify emerging threats.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts clearly.
• Ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural /diverse team environment.
• Relevant security industry certifications are a plus.
• Knowledge of relevant security standards and financial regulations is a plus (like PSD2, EBA GL, NIS, DORA, NIST CSF, SWIFT CSCF, PCI DSS, ISO/IEC 27001/27002)
• Fluency in English; other languages are an advantage
Your Competences:
• Diversity - treating other mentalities and cultures with respect and fairness
• Result orientation - high level of self-responsibility; produce measurable results; pursue objectives consequently
• Innovation and Change - Generate ideas and support the implementation; adjust to changing situations, critical thinking and strong problem-solving skills
• Resilience - ability to act calmly and competently in high-pressure, high-stress situation
• Reliable - high level of personal integrity, as well as the ability to professionally handle confidential matters, and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity
Our Offer
• We are a team who live and breathe continuous improvement and digital transformation, opens the door for new opportunities and also push boundaries
• We are open minded, honest, supportive and always ready to go the extra mile for great solutions
• Interest groups and clubs: Take part in discussions and get involved in projects. Numerous interest groups invite you to engage with a topic
• Good food: Healthy nutrition and good food are important for our quality of life. With seven restaurants and cafeterias, there's something to suit every taste on the Erste Campus
• Health Centre - The Erste Campus operates a fully equipped health centre that offers all employees a high standard of medical services during working hours.
• A competitive and performance-related salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications is granted - the minimum wage for this position in accordance with the respective collective agreement is EUR 49.458,64,- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person
Apply online

title: Business Data Analyst (m/w/d) für Sustainability Data Management...
description:
Stellenbeschreibung

Zusammenfassung

Einleitung:

Als Business Data Analyst (m/w/d) für Sustainability Data Management und Reporting hast du die Möglichkeit, Unternehmen dabei zu unterstützen, ihre Nachhaltigkeitsziele zu erreichen und ihre Daten effizient zu verwalten. In dieser Rolle wirst du Teil eines führenden Unternehmensberatungsunternehmens für Umwelt und Nachhaltigkeit, das seit 30 Jahren in Mittel- und Osteuropa tätig ist. Du wirst eng mit verschiedenen Unternehmen zusammenarbeiten, um ihre Nachhaltigkeitsdaten zu analysieren, zu interpretieren und zu visualisieren. Deine Aufgaben umfassen auch die Entwicklung und Implementierung von Datenmanagementprozessen sowie die Weiterentwicklung von Business Intelligence-Lösungen. Wenn du ein/e erfahrene/r Datenanalyst/in bist und dich für Nachhaltigkeit interessierst, dann ist diese Position genau das Richtige für dich.

Aufgaben
• Effektive Datenerhebung, Data Pipelining (ETLs), an unterschiedliche Systeme und Schnittstellen... anknüpfen, vom Interpretieren und Visualisieren von ESG-Daten bis hin zur Kommunikation und Ableitung von Schlussfolgerungen
• Notwendige ESG Datenarchitektur in verschiedenen Unternehmen umsetzen und bestehenden Business Intelligence-Lösungen (weiter)entwickeln
• Regulatorische Anforderungen im Nachhaltigkeits-Reporting in bestehenden und neue innovative IT-Lösungen übersetzen
• Entwickeln, begleiten und implementieren von Datenmanagementprozessen direkt in Unternehmen, Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholder*innen in der Data Governance

Anforderungen
• Abgeschlossenes einschlägiges Hochschulstudium wie z B. (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Data Science, Data Analytics, Physik, Mathematik, Umweltwissenschaften, Wirtschaft mit quantitativer Spezialisierung
• Mind. 2 Jahre praktische Erfahrung im Bereich (Business) Data Analysis, Datenmanagement, Software Development
• Inhaltliche und konzeptionelle Expertise im Umgang mit Business Intelligence Lösungen (wie Power BI, Looker, Tableau, SAP, SAS Business Intelligence, etc.)
• Kenntnisse in Python, SQL, R von Vorteil
• Sehr gute Kenntnis von Statistik, Machine Learning und Datenvisualisierung
• Gute Projektmanagementkenntnisse in Theorie und Praxis
• Hohe Analyse- und Problemlösungsfähigkeiten
• Verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse

Benefits
• Vielfältige und spannende Themen, in einem werteorientierten Umfeld, bei dem Du jeden Tag aufs Neue einen Beitrag zum Klimaschutz leistest
• Vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten innerhalb der Organisation
• Alle-ziehen-an-einem-Strang-Kultur, 'Du'-Kultur
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten, mit vielen Freiräumen, flachen Hierarchien und der Möglichkeit rasch Verantwortung zu übernehmen
• Starke Lernkultur und Raum für Entwicklung
• Modernes Büro mit guter öffentlicher Erreichbarkeit (Nähe U-Bahn-Station Hietzing U4) und die Möglichkeit auf Remote-Arbeit
• Frisch gekochtes nachhaltiges Essen 4x/Woche durch unseren eigenen Koch
• Das Gehalt orientiert sich an Deiner Qualifikation und Erfahrung, ab € 50.000 brutto/Jahr plus variabler Vergütung. Zusätzlich gibt es ein attraktives Bonusmodell

description:
Group Description

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.

Role Summary

The Business Intelligence (BI) Developer/Analyst will be responsible for interpreting the business needs of HR stakeholders and for developing the reporting analytics that meet those needs. This includes the design, development, maintenance, integration and reporting of business systems through cubes, ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. The Business Intelligence... Developer/Analyst will work closely and effectively with internal stakeholders and business analysts to provide support and expertise in data management, reporting and underlying infrastructure. This position may also need to cover oversight and guidance on deliverables provided by external partners as well a supervising & leading role in the team.

Key Responsibilities
• Work with the business to define reporting/BI requirements and translate those requirements into reporting/BI deliverables.
• Design complex business intelligence and analytic solutions based on functional requirements.
• Translate data results into written reports, tables, graphs, and charts.
• Ensure the availability and performance of the solutions and reports.
• Participate in and lead functional and technical specification reviews.
• Research technical solutions to solve business problems.
• Develop/train on company standards and procedures to support self-service BI.
• Provide training and technical assistance to other team members and users for generation of various types of reporting.
• Provide ongoing support for legacy and future BI solutions.

Work Experience
• 3 to 5 Years of Work Related Experience.

Knowledge and Education
• Completion of University Degree in the field of computer science or Information Technology.

Key Qualifications/Requirements
• Experience in developing reporting or dashboard solutions with BI tools (PowerBI preferred).
• Experience in creating data models (SSAS Tabular Model preferred).
• Proficiency in ETL and Data Warehouse concepts.
• Strong SQL and scripting skills.
• Advanced skills in Microsoft BI stack (SSAS, Power Pivot, Power View, PowerBI).
• Self-motivated and self-managed with a high degree of analytical skills (quick comprehension, abstract thinking, recognize relationships).
• Ability to be a strong team member and communicate effectively.
• Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks.
• Demonstrated critical thinking and analytic skills with strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
• Ability to manage confidential and sensitive employee information.
• Ability to accurately collect information to understand and assess the clients’ needs and situation.
• Understanding of HR operations and processes, and experience in employee data management a nice to have.
• Excellent English language skills (written and oral).

Additional Information

Salary starting from 45 000 EUR/ gross/year. We offer attractive benefits (expl. profit participation, yearly bonus, development opportunities).

For dedicated and motivated employees, we offer an interesting and diversified job within a dynamic global team together with the individual and functional development in a professional environment of a global acting business. Fair treatment and a sense of responsibility towards employees are the principle of the Magna culture. We strive to offer an inspiring and motivating work environment.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law

title: Manufacturing Business Analyst (f/m/d)
description:
Manufacturing Business Analyst

Make the vision of a Siemens IT/OT ecosystem for smart manufacturing real!

“Technology with purpose” means the translation of IT technology into business value. Especially for new and innovative technology, as is so often in the field of IoT, this process must be accompanied and moderated.

For this reason, the role of a business analyst with a technical focus is essential. In this role, you will either come from processes and translate which IT building blocks are needed to digitize manufacturing processes, or you will come from technology and show process responsible how the technology can be used to create value in their domain. For this task, you should have a background in manufacturing and domain knowledge in the areas of production and (intra) logistics.

Besides of this you will act in the role of an ambassador driving IT/OT convergence forward, facilitating IT/OT communities and taking over the product owner role for the “solution platform” –... a marketplace for factories to accelerate their digital transformation.

In this role you will work intensively with colleagues from MF, IT and DI product units to achieve the optimum for Siemens.

What part will you play?
• Leading project modules for (Siemens internal) market & demand analysis with focus on manufacturing
• Screening and analyzing use cases as part of projects and co-creations or customer-zero initiatives
• Deriving requirements for required products, solutions and IT services to elevate the maximum of value
• Driving co-creations and customer-zero deployments between factories, solution providers and IT
• Building up topic driven interdisciplinary communities with representatives from MF, IT and solution providers
• Working on new business models which are driven by IT/OT convergence
• Being responsible in the role of a “product manager” for the evolution of “Solution Platform” – a marketplace for Siemens factories

What you need to make real what matters?
• A University degree in engineering or IT
• Several years’ experience and background in manufacturing
• Experience in business process analysis and projects
• Understanding of Siemens Digital Industries portfolio e.g. MES, Intralogistics, Digital Twin
• A passion for IT/OT convergence and understand requirements and dependencies
• Good moderation skills, the ability to open rooms for visionary discussions, as well as to drive meetings to concrete practical and valuable outcomes
• You are a systemic problem solver and you are able to connect the dots
• You play in teams and have excellent people skills and the adaptability to connect quickly with people
• Proficiency in English and German would be an add-on

We’ve got quite a lot to offer. How about you?

title: Senior Data Analyst/Architect (f/m/d/)
description:
Job Family: Information Technology

Req ID: 375838

Rethinking IT.

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitalization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Be bold when others would have given up. In short, play a key role in driving digitalization forward! We’ll provide the resources you need to do this. We also offer a variety of opportunities to get involved and to be part of a global network of IT experts and professionals. Welcome to our world!

We make real what matters. This is your role.

Vision:

As data is supposed to be the new oil, making tangible value out of data will make the difference and is what we are striving for.

Supporting the business in decision making and... answering increasingly complex questions in ever shorter time or even real time is our aspiration.

Mission:

By combining a profound knowledge of finance and related end-2-end processes with deep technical know-how and a fresh thinking with respect to problem solving, we provide state of the art IT solutions, services and platforms for finance departments with a focus on reporting, analytics and planning.

Key Areas of Responsibility:
• Be the data architect in the relaunch of a solution for group consolidation with a focus on the provision of an integrated data layer that enables a pass-through from consolidated data to unconsolidated ERP data
• Permanent self-reliant optimization of data models (in the context of SAP BW/4, Snowflake, S/4HANA)
• You envision, design and implement architectures and data models optimized for the integration of various, heterogenous data sources. You extend our service offering by business intelligence and reporting solutions to effectively deal with the new non-financial reporting requirements like the EU Taxonomy.
• Autonomously deliver/lead projects mainly in the context of an SAP BW/4 environment
• Perform complex changes in alignment with BI colleagues and business stakeholders
• Constantly provide innovations to improve or enhance analytics related solutions and service offering
• Provide added value to data analytics initiatives / projects (migrations, predictive analytics, SAC, new projects)
• Manage and coordinate external partners and communicate with various business stakeholders for the successful completion of projects and changes in existing solutions

Use your skills to move the world forward.
• University degree in IT or Business Insights related field
• Many years of experience in analytics and reporting (SAP BW, SAP ABAP, SAP BW/4). Experience in an international group company and experience in SAP Group reporting are valued.
• Extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes and reporting (SAP AO, SAC)
• Knowledge on HANA Studio (SQL/Java Script), experience in cloud platforms, as well as any other BI tool are valued
• Practical experience in collaborating with business stakeholders, experience within the area of Accounting / Controlling / Closing process is valued
• Ability to learn and adapt to new environments / contexts / applications
• Business Value and Customer focused, as well as goal-oriented professional with innovative thinking and attention to detail and a team player
• Project Management experience in agile methodology
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and willingness to work in a multicultural team
• Strong engineering/analytic skills and in leading BI projects and data expertise (modelling, analytics, prediction, simulation, AI/ML) and profound background in digitalization technologies is highly valued
• Business fluent English and German

title: Application Demand Analyst
description:
Company Description

As a global powerhouse in the hospitality and airline industry, DO & CO is one of the most exciting and revered businesses across the globe. With unparalleled opulence and prestige, DO & CO provides thrilling chances to work at our headquarters in Finance, IT, Logistics, Procurements, Graphic Design, HR and much more. With our global presence and commitment to luxury, you'll have the chance to work on exciting projects that will take your career to new heights.

Job Description

As an Application Demand Analyst, you'll capture and plan application maintenance, changes, upgrades, and projects to best practice standards. Maintain a current demand pipeline, identify conflicts and dependencies, and ensure compliance with Change Control standards. Coordinate project delivery and deployment with functional and IT leads. Highlight non-compliance and maintain quality standards for project documentation.
• Develop, implement, and ensure an up-to-date plan is available... demand for application maintenance, changes, upgrades, and projects.
• Ensuring all changes adhere to our Change Control process.
• Provides basic guidance and advice on application demand requests and how to submit them correctly.
• Sets-up, support and provides guidance on our application planning tools and procedures.
• Provide a reporting service to the head of applications management on all aspects of team activity, reporting variance to plan and escalation where appropriate to assure a co-ordinated programme of activities is maintained.
• Provides process and administrative assistance, as required, to the Head of Application Management.

Qualifications
• We are looking for someone who ...
• At least 5 years experience in any project-oriented IT function OR has equivalent non-IT experience and has received training in IT project development methodology and terminology
• Strong written and oral expression in English and German
• Familiar with System Development Lifecycle and the terms SSADM and DSDM
• Great attention to detail to apply high quality standards to all task in hand
• Experience with Project management tools such as PMW and Microsoft PROJECT
• Superior numeracy skills in order to understand the metric asociated with a problem or situation

Additional Information

We believe that our employees are the driving force behind our success and strive to create a positive and supportive work environment. As a member of our team, you will have access to a range of benefits, including:
• Starting annual salary of €50.000
• An excellent workplace to call home, events, fun colleagues, and all other regular salary/benefits stuff
• We're not afraid of new ideas for a business where you can have a real impact!
• Genuine career development opportunities, both nationally and internationally.
• The opportunity to work with and represent one of the most innovative players in the luxury global gourmet entertainment market

DO&CO is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status

title: Junior Business Analyst
description:
Junior Business Analyst (all genders) im regulatorischen Reporting

Die Erste Group Services (EGS) ist das operative Kompetenzzentrum für Finanz-Services (Accounting und Taxes), HR-Services (Personalverrechnung und Personalmanagement-Services) und Reporting (externes und internes Meldewesen und Meldewesen-Projekte) für die Erste Group Bank AG, die Erste Bank der oesterreichischen Sparkassen AG, deren inländischen Konzerngesellschaften und Sparkassen. Wir sind ein kundenfokussiertes, innovatives und mitarbeiterorientiertes Shared Service Center.

Unsere Haupttätigkeiten liegen in der Prozessierung, Aufbereitung und Meldung von Daten für das regulatorische Reporting nach dem OeNB-Datenmodell, laufende Projektarbeit, sowie Kommunikation innerhalb der Erste Group, dem österreichischen Sparkassen-Sektor und zur österreichischen Bankenaufsicht.

Wir suchen eine/n Mitarbeiter:in mit Interesse am Bankgeschäft und Finanzprodukten oder Business Analyse im Bankenumfeld. Du möchtest deine... Fähigkeiten im regulatorischen Reporting von Banken einbringen und ausbauen. Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerung

Deine Tasks
• Durchführung der monatlichen Datenprozessierung für den österreichischen Sparkassensektor
• Analyse der Meldedaten und Meldungsübermittlung an die österreichische Bankenaufsicht
• Bearbeitung von Rückfragen und Kommunikation mit der Aufsicht
• Definition von Anforderungen und Änderungsanträgen für technische Implementierungen
• Koordination und Durchführung von Anwendertests

Dein Background
• Kaufmännische oder allgemein höhere Ausbildung (BHS, AHS oder gleichwertig)
• Kenntnisse und Verständnis von Datenbanken/Data-Marts bzw. MS-Office Kenntnisse (Excel, Access, Word and Power Point)
• Analytische Fähigkeiten, Kommunikations- und Präsentations-Skills sowie pro-aktive Herangehensweise
• Kenntnisse in SQL von Vorteil

Unser Angebot
• Eine verantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Position in einem kooperativen und dynamischen Team, welches eine große Vielfalt an unterschiedlichen regulatorischen Berichtsverpflichtungen von nationalen und europäischen Aufsichtsbehörden behandelt
• Attraktive Karrieremöglichkeiten in einem professionellen Team
• Flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, eine Vielzahl an Sozialleistungen und eine moderne Arbeitsumgebung sowie individuelle Homeoffice-Lösungen für unsere Mitarbeiter:innen
• Entdecke die zusätzlichen der Erste Group
• Das Mindestentgelt für diese Vollzeitposition (38,5h) nach dem geltenden Kollektivvertrag beträgt 30.508,52 Euro brutto pro Jahr bei vollständiger Erfüllung des Funktionsprofils. Aber das ist nur eine Formalität - über dein tatsächliches Gehalt sprechen wir gerne persönlich

title: Demand Planning and Market Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
Location: Austria, Linz

Type: Permanent

Application Deadline: 31/07/2023

Hours: Full-time

Are you interested in economic developments and have an IT affinity? We are looking for a Demand Planning and Market Intelligence Analyst (m,f,d) for our location in Linz.

Your duties and responsibilities:
• As DP & MI Analyst, you will analyze and interpret developments in the daily economic world events and the chemical/fertilizer industry and evaluate its implications for NITRO's businesses
• Regular assessment of selected key competitors to compare performance, strengths/weaknesses and identification of potential business opportunities will be part of your responsibilities
• The DP & MI analyst supports the monthly S&OP and demand forecasting process, in order to be in line with the current business strategy and the overall objective of margin optimization
• You will collaborate with a diverse international network of internal and external stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and to stay... up-to-date with emerging trends and market developments
• As DP & MI Analyst, you will be the driver for the improvement and development of state-of-the-art analysis and planning tools, which foster a fast, efficient and profound decision-making process based on market trends

About you

This is the right job for you, if you have the passion to analyze quantitative and qualitative data in order to derive clear messages as a basis for operative demand planning and mid- to long-term strategic decisions. You will be able to excel in this exciting role if you possess below competences, skills & attitudes:
• You have advanced IT-capabilities (Power BI, Excel). Skills in database and/or programming languages (Python, R, SQL,…) would be a highly appreciated asset.
• You enjoy a dynamic business environment where almost no year is like the other and topics to analyze seem endless. You see an obstacle along the way as a chance to learn and grow together with your internal and external stakeholders at the same time – even if this obstacle will sometimes test your resilience.
• Ideally, you have finished a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data-Science, Economics, Finance, Agronomy, or a related field. It would be a plus when you have already gained work experience, preferably in the chemical industry.
• Fluency in English is a must and every additional language is an asset.
• You are our ideal candidate when you possess strong analytical skills and are strong in conceptual thinking.
• You will be working in a small team with a wide variety of responsibilities, therefore, being a team player with a hands-on mentality and an intercultural mind-set is essential.

You will be the right candidate for this exciting position if you love to work with data and IT tools in a fast changing industry and are willing to utilize your current skills and continuously learn something new!

We offer

We offer a competitive compensation based on the collective labour agreement of chemical industries starting at EUR 54.740, - annual gross salary, a yearly bonus and other fringe benefits including a voluntary pension plan.

The actual payment depends on the respective qualification or professional experience. We will determine the actual amount in a personal interview. Significant over-payment is possible with appropriate suitability.We reserve the right to close this vacancy for further applications when we have received sufficient applications that meet the advertised requirements and will contact you as soon as screening is closed.

Thank you for applying online with your CV and cover letter (in English language) to the attention of Waltraud Resch, waltraud.resch@lat-nitrogen.com, +43732 6914 5949

title: BI Developer/Analyst (m/f/x), HR Systems
description:
Group Description

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We're the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we're more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it's our talented people who lead us on this journey.

Role Summary

The Business Intelligence (BI) Developer/Analyst will be responsible for interpreting the business needs of HR stakeholders and for developing the reporting analytics that meet those needs. This includes the design, development, maintenance, integration and reporting of business systems through cubes, ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. The Business Intelligence... Developer/Analyst will work closely and effectively with internal stakeholders and business analysts to provide support and expertise in data management, reporting and underlying infrastructure. This position may also need to cover oversight and guidance on deliverables provided by external partners as well a supervising & leading role in the team.

Key Responsibilities
• Work with the business to define reporting/BI requirements and translate those requirements into reporting/BI deliverables.
• Design complex business intelligence and analytic solutions based on functional requirements.
• Translate data results into written reports, tables, graphs, and charts.
• Ensure the availability and performance of the solutions and reports.
• Participate in and lead functional and technical specification reviews.
• Research technical solutions to solve business problems.
• Develop/train on company standards and procedures to support self-service BI.
• Provide training and technical assistance to other team members and users for generation of various types of reporting.
• Provide ongoing support for legacy and future BI solutions.

Work Experience
• 3 to 5 Years of Work Related Experience.

Knowledge and Education
• Completion of University Degree in the field of computer science or Information Technology.

Key Qualifications/Requirements
• Experience in developing reporting or dashboard solutions with BI tools (PowerBI preferred).
• Experience in creating data models (SSAS Tabular Model preferred).
• Proficiency in ETL and Data Warehouse concepts.
• Strong SQL and scripting skills.
• Advanced skills in Microsoft BI stack (SSAS, Power Pivot, Power View, PowerBI).
• Self-motivated and self-managed with a high degree of analytical skills (quick comprehension, abstract thinking, recognize relationships).
• Ability to be a strong team member and communicate effectively.
• Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks.
• Demonstrated critical thinking and analytic skills with strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
• Ability to manage confidential and sensitive employee information.
• Ability to accurately collect information to understand and assess the clients' needs and situation.
• Understanding of HR operations and processes, and experience in employee data management a nice to have.
• Excellent English language skills (written and oral).

Additional Information

Salary starting from 45 000 EUR/ gross/year. We offer attractive benefits (expl. profit participation, yearly bonus, development opportunities).

For dedicated and motivated employees, we offer an interesting and diversified job within a dynamic global team together with the individual and functional development in a professional environment of a global acting business. Fair treatment and a sense of responsibility towards employees are the principle of the Magna culture. We strive to offer an inspiring and motivating work environment.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That's why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law

title: Business Data Analyst – Project Controls (m/w/x)
description:
Business Data Analyst – Project Controls (m/w/x)

Vollzeit, ab sofort

Wallern an der Trattnach

Heldenhafte Taten
• In dieser neu geschaffenen Position analysieren Sie Daten aus der Projektverfolgungsdatenbank, um wichtige Erkenntnisse und Trends zu gewinnen.
• Sie entwerfen, entwickeln und pflegen Power BI Berichte und Dashboards für verschiedene Bauprojekte.
• Sie arbeiten mit Projektmanagern und Stakeholdern zusammen, um Anforderungen zu erfassen und Geschäftsziele zu verstehen.
• Sie helfen bei der Identifizierung von Datenqualitätsproblemen und arbeiten mit dem Datenteam zusammen, um Lösungen zu implementieren.
• Sie führen Analysen zur Unterstützung von Entscheidungsprozessen durch und geben umsetzbare Empfehlungen.
• Sie halten sich über die besten Praktiken und Trends in den Bereichen Datenanalyse, Business Intelligence und Projektmanagement auf dem Laufenden.
• Earned Value Tracking
• Messung des Projektfortschritts
• Aufgewandte Stunden
• Verdiente Stunden
•... Fortschrittsbewertung und -verfolgung über Projekte hinweg
• Zählerstand
• Durchmesser – Zoll

Benötigte Superkräfte
• Hochschulabschluss in Informationstechnologie, Informatik, Ingenieurwesen oder einem verwandten Bereich.
• Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise in der Baubranche, ist erwünscht.
• (Ausgeprägte) Kenntnisse von Power BI, einschließlich Datenmodellierung, Berichtsentwicklung und Dashboard-Erstellung.
• Vertrautheit mit Projektmanagement-Methoden ist erwünscht.
• Excel-Kenntnisse und Erfahrung mit Datenbanksystemen wie SQL Server oder PostgreSQL sind eine gute Ergänzung.
• Ausgezeichnete Problemlösungs-, Analyse- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten.
• Fähigkeit, in einem schnelllebigen Umfeld selbstständig und im Team zu arbeiten

title: International Business Analyst
description:
Full-time

International Business Analyst - Retail

Fuschl, Austria

Apply now

Do you have a passion for analysis, reporting and providing insights? This Business Analyst role in our International HQ could be for you

The International Business Analyst will play an integral role in the International Retail Key Account team by creating, maintaining, and analyzing centralized KPI reports. The International Business Analyst will be responsible for the coordination and communication of the International Retail Key Account performance internally and externally. Also, will be the key user of data platforms relating to sales and budgeting. As a third pillar, the Business Analyst will drive best practice sharing to the wider Sales Off Premise community via our intranet.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Areas that play to your strengths

All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:

Business Reporting

In this role you will be responsible for optimizing and updating the International Key Account monthly... volume and turnover report as well as do some accurate maintenance of the International Agreement investment for CPM and non-CPM markets in close collaboration with International Key Account Managers and Sales Controlling. You'll also update our quarterly International Key Account Turnover declarations and in-store initiative scorecards. Ad-hoc customer reporting & presentations will also be a part of your scope.

Business Analysis and collaboration

You'll manage the International Retail Sharepoint page with regular best practice sharing and publication of relevant industry news, Deliver insights from the Global Key Account Managers dashboard and customer sell-out data, provide ad hoc value chain analysis on specific customers and International Key Account exposure analysis, support feedback on the global Key Account Managers section of the annual business plans submitted by the top 30 markets and track local market customer Sustainability requests and responses.

Experience

Your areas of knowledge and expertise

That matter most for this role:
• University Degree
• Excellent English Skills
• Strong analytical skills with commercial acumen to deliver relevant actionable insights
• High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
• Able to communicate effectively with stakeholders at different levels of the organization, across functions and from different cultural backgrounds
• Solution-oriented mindset with good problem-solving skills
• Attention to detail
• Quick learner, curious and self-motivated with an ability to work independently
• A team player with high integrity
• Travel: 10-20 %
JOIN THE TEAM

Got what it takes?

In your application we want to see your personal style - what makes you tick and why you think your next opportunity is here with us.

Apply now

As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. The job advertisement is aimed at all people equally, regardless of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin. Due to legal reasons we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is EUR 2.041 gross per month. However, our attractive compensation package is based on market-oriented salaries and is therefore significantly above the stated minimum salary. As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin
